posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
And this one is exciting for us!

https://www.beamdog.com/news/nwnee-patc ... cos-linux/
Weapons-related feats (Focus, Epic Focus, Spec, Epic Spec, Improved Crit, Overwhelming Crit, Devastating Crit, Weapon of Choice) can now be customised on a per-baseitem case.
Yesssss, my precious!

Spartans!  One handed spears!  Yes, you heard right!

And this one :
Custom spellcaster classes
We've added (somewhat partial) support for custom spellcaster classes by "unhardcoding" a lot of the builtin constants and references.
Please refer to classes.2da for the new columns: MemorizesSpells SpellbookRestricted PickDomains PickSchool LearnScroll Arcane ASF SpellcastingAbil SpellTableColumn CLMultiplier MinCastingLevel MinAssociateLevel CanCastSpontaneously
Note that not all combinations are valid. We recommend cloning one of the existing caster classes and then start customising from there. When adding spellcasting to new classes, remember to also update existing columns.
There is also a new ruleset entry: COMPANION_LEVELS_STACK, defaulting to 0.
This one *IS* a game changer for us here.  Once the dust settles, and we know precisely what does and what does not work, a LOT of things will need reworking and consideration!

It's a great time to be a NWN Character Builder!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I updated to 1.80 last night and noticed a bug during character creation.

When making a non-caster class (Barb, Figh, Monk, Rog) you can't lower STR below 11 (including racial modifiers) once you have increased it. You can leave it at the base 6/8/10 with no issues, but once you have increased it it's not possible to decrease it to below 11. I assume that this is due to non-caster classes having their casting ability set to STR in the updated 2da files, but I haven't looked at them so I might be wrong. For anybody else dealing with this bug, reselecting your class resets your ability increases.

Has anybody else experienced this bug?
